      • setStateKey

        public FulgoraBuilder<S> setStateKey(String stateKey)
        Description copied from interface: OLAPJobBuilder
        Defines the name of the key to be used as the dedicated "state" key. Retrieving the property value for this key on any given vertex in an OLAPJob will return the current vertex state.
        Specified by:
        setStateKey in interface OLAPJobBuilder<S>

      • setInitialState

        public OLAPJobBuilder<S> setInitialState(OLAPResult<S> values)
        Description copied from interface: OLAPJobBuilder
        Sets the initial state of the vertices to the result from a previous OLAP computation.

        Note, that the data structures underlying the OLAPResult may be removed to be memory efficient which means that the previous state can be overwritten and is therefore lost.

        Specified by:
        setInitialState in interface OLAPJobBuilder<S>
        Returns:

      • setNumVertices

        public FulgoraBuilder<S> setNumVertices(long numVertices)
        Description copied from interface: OLAPJobBuilder
        If the exact number of vertices to be processed is know a priori, it can be specified via this method to make memory allocation more efficient. Setting is value is optional and does not impact correctness. Providing the exact number of vertices might make execution faster.
        Specified by:
        setNumVertices in interface OLAPJobBuilder<S>
        Returns:

      • setNumProcessingThreads

      • addQuery

        public OLAPQueryBuilder addQuery()
        Description copied from interface: OLAPJobBuilder
        Adds a new vertex query to this job. The vertex queries specify which edges and properties will be accessible when the configured OLAPJob executes. Only the data that can be retrieved through previously configured queries will be accessible during execution.
        Specified by:
        addQuery in interface OLAPJobBuilder<S>
        Returns:
